message: The parser, and a failing spec are in GitHub at https://github.com/MarkBennett/css-smasher/tree/work. The spec tries to parse a simplified ruleset ("p { b }") but fails indicating that it's expecting a "{".
The actual grammar file I'm using is at https://github.com/MarkBennett/css-smasher/blob/work/lib/parser.jison

This is my first time using jison (https://github.com/zaach/jison) to create a CSS parser, and am running into some trouble. I've created a grammar which I think should parse a basic CSS ruleset, but running the parser against a simple CSS file fails to parse.
"cake build:watch" runs coffee script to build/watch my coffeescripts
You can run the specs with "cake spec", or generate the parser with "cake build:parser".
-g

cake spec shows all green

I think I've narrowed it down to a problem with the lexical parsing. I added a console.log to each line of the lexical parsing so I could see it finding tokens. It's finding two IDENTS for the ruleset, but not the "{" or "}"
Hmm, I've just found an implementations of jslint in jison that escapes the action for the "{" token with %{ and %} https://github.com/zaach/jsonlint/blob/master/src/jsonlint.l#L10
Ok. I'm going to go offline and figure this out. Thx for talking a look @darkhelmetlive!
[_a-z0-9-]*  <-- change the * to a +
Your IDENT match is wrong
In my experience I screw up 99% of all parsers with something like this
because the * matches 0 or more IDENTs
That worked! Thanks @Blaze!
